oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Forester Sisters Interview - Biff Collie - Tape 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 1 of 2. Recording of an interview with Forester Sisters (performance group) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Forester Sisters; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) The Forester Sisters talk about the first snowfall on Christmas in their life -- (01:08) The Forester Sisters talk about always wanting to be at their mother's and their mother's sickness -- (02:39) Kim Forester tells where she lived and almost electing herself -- (03:14) Chris Forester jokes about dropping Kim on her head -- (03:31) Kim and Chris talk about Chris' hair embarrassing her as a child -- (04:13) June, Chris, and Kim Forester talk about seeing children for the first time and Chris' pregnancy -- (05:20) Chris, Kim, and June talk about Kathy having to practice instrumentation constantly -- (06:25) Kim talks about June's experimentations with food -- (06:48) June talks about Kim and Christy trying to get her to stand up only to go limp -- (07:29) Biff Collie attempts to figure out the sibling role -- (07:37) Kathy talks about singing while working and June recalls having the role as the house keeper -- (08:40) Kathy recalls a time from her youth, making gravy, and her dad calling her food oatmeal -- (09:16) Collie jokes with all the Forester Sisters' about their role in the family -- (10:40) The Forester Sisters recall a time where they tied Kim to a tree -- (11:34) Kim talks about her domestic roles -- (11:56) Christy and the Forester Sisters joke about her baby sitting role and her having money -- (14:13) Collie and the Forester talk about Christy's nickname Ivana Trump -- (15:01) The Forester Sisters talk about how Christy's frugality comes forth -- (17:06) Collie and The Forester Sisters talk about how they first started singing together in church -- (18:02) The Forester Sisters and Collie talk about 'Singing Schools' as a form of recreation -- (20:28) The Forester Sisters talk about the vast amount of musicians from their home town and the 'All Day Singin' event -- (21:24) The Forester Sisters discuss their grandma as a large women who couldn't walk in heels -- (22:01) Kathy talk about the Bradford family and her friend Louise -- (22:55) The Forester Sisters joke about a third grade love named John -- (24:12) Kim talks about Kathy receiving a bracelet from a guy who liked her -- (24:39) Kathy talks about the eventual change of life because of dating -- (25:43) Kathy talks about a poorly dressed date -- (26:03) Kim talks about being in multiple extra-curricular activities and her sisters messing up -- (27:09) The Forester Sisters joke about June hitting her head and crashing driving to church -- (29:05) Collie and the Forester Sisters discuss the artistic side of their hometown -- (31:12) Kathy talks about Plum Nelly -- (31:40) Kim and Kathy tells about decorating cakes as children and Kim tells about getting her tongue stuck -- (33:41) Kathy talks about singing at their first festival and singing at ceremonies -- (34:48) Collie talks to the Forester Sisters practicing music despite life pulling them further apart -- (36:39) Kim and Christy talk about their college majors -- (37:06) Collie and the Forester Sisters joke about Kim and Christy's career choices; then, talked about deciding to do a demo tape -- (38:54) Kim talks about the difficulty in getting interested parties to come see a performance -- (39:59) Kim talks about their first producer and performing for twenty Warner Brothers executives -- (41:30) Kathy talks about the process of celebrating their first deal -- (42:31) The Forester Sisters talk about quitting their jobs to work in the studio and the struggles their first year -- (43:51) Kathy talks about the changing life style and her / Kristy's love life while touring with the Oak Ridge Boys -- (45:01) Collie and Kristy talk about Ricky Skaggs and Kristy's husband -- (45:33) The Forester Sisters and Collie talk about their entire entourage -- (46:10) Kathy talks about the Forester Sisters' aunt and their extended family -- (47:32) The Forester Sisters talk about what happens when they get off the road -- (48:50) Kristy talks about how she's in the process of becoming a farm owner -- (49:28) The Forester Sisters talk about being nominated for awards and only winning an ACM award in 1987 -- (50:07) The Forester Sisters talk about how the couldn't contain their excitement when they won their award -- (51:03) The Forester Sisters talks about the Forester Sisters' shows and what they want to be remembered as after the show -- (52:40) The Forester Sisters talk about establishing their own individual identities -- (53:15) The Forester Sisters' influences are discussed -- (53:51) June talks about getting tired and all their musical tastes -- (54:24) The Forester Sisters and Collie discuss whether they have considered being a solo act -- (54:55) June talks about her professional goals of owning a business and having a family -- (55:25) Kim talks about wanting children and not wanting a road life for them -- (56:15) Kristy talks about wanting to improve her writing skills and family values -- (56:45) Kathy talks about honing her skills -- (57:30) The Forester Sisters talk about their grandmother as the most unforgettable character -- (58:48) Collie and the Forester Sisters talk about their parents
